headline: Apple Cake IV
description: A great tasting, moist cake and a great way to use up extra apples
name: Apple Cake IV

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) lightly grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan.
Sift together flour, salt, cinnamon and baking powder. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat eggs and sugar for 15 minutes on high speed with an electric mixer. Add oil and blend in.
Add four mixture and mix well. Add vanilla. Fold in apples and nuts. Pour batter into 9x13 inch pan.
In a small bowl, mix 4 teaspoons sugar with 1 teaspoon cinnamon. Sprinkle over cake.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center of cake comes out clean.

review.reviewBody: Easy and delicious
Only added 1/2 tsp of nutmeg, otherwise made it per the recipe. Loved it.
Simple, quick and delicious!!

Perfect recipe. Super soft, moist and flavorful with a little bit of a crunchy top. It was just what I was looking for, I’m already planning on making it again within the next few weeks. I used 4 Granny Smith apples and one Honey crisp apple. Love this, thank you!
We love this recipe! It's really sweet but moist and delicious. I may try cutting back on the sugar next time.
This was delicious, but I did make the following change - replaced 2C white sugar with 1C white sugar, and 1/2C brown sugar.
This is the very best apple cake I have ever made. I find myself craving for it.
It was fantastic and my family loved it. Next time I will make a crumble for the topping instead of just sugar and cinnamon.

Many years ago I had a recipe but lost it, I tried this because it seemed that I remembered this recipe, as I made it often, My family, as well as myself, love it for any time of year. It is the same delicious recipe, if not even more delicious. I guarantee that you will not be disappointed.
Made a few adjustments: reduced sugar (1 cup white, 1/2 cup brown), 1/2 cup oil and 1/2 cup melted butter. Baked in a Bundt pan. Flavorful and not overly sweet. Very popular with the family.
Came out ok, not sure why it's so highly rated though
Love it!

This was delicious, easy to make with simple on-hand ingredients, and met with rave reviews! I only had 3 apples so I substituted 2 peaches and it was just as tasty, otherwise made it exactly per instructions. Next time I will try less sugar, less cinnamon.
This was delicious!! I substituted 1/3c monk fruit for 1c sugar and was plenty sweet.

Delicious cake with strong cinnamon flavor! I used gala apples. It's a lot a apples for the amount of batter! But you get tender and sweet pieces of apples in every bite. You definitely could reduce the sugar here. I only used half the sugar called for and the cake was plenty sweet for me.

This recipe takes a lot of work in preparation! If you have bad knees, think twice about standing while you are doing all the peeling, slicing, measuring, pouring, folding etc. A good thing I have a heavy duty Kitchen Aid mixer. The mixture is very, very sticky and it was hard for me to get it out of the mixing bowl and into the baking pan. This better be good! I used walnut oil instead of vegetable oil in place of adding the chopped walnuts. The flavor will be there, but without the nuts that some don't care for. I also substituted organic brown sugar for refined white sugar - that stuff is bad for you. OK, I used white sugar in the topping sprinkle! It is baking now. We will soon see: PERFECT! The cake is light and moist, the Fuji Apples, sweetness, and spice level delicious. Thank you.
Very good! Next time I will chop the apples though but still very good.

This turned out so good looking that I really didn’t want to give it away! Only thing I did differently was to drizzle confection sugar and half and half mixed together just for contrast . I watched the baking time, as 55 to 60 minutes was a bit too long . 50 minutes in my oven was done, checked with a toothpick !
Would benefit from adding nutmeg and powdered ginger, possibly substituting some Brown Sugar for the white. Cooking time for my oven was 1:20 and it was still very moist.

This recipe turned out amazingly well! I'll admit I was hesitant about the minute time for the eggs and sugar, but I did do it this way and I believe it contributed to the beautiful rise of the cake. I subbed 1/2c full fat sour cream and only 1/2c of oil. I used 1 1/2 c white sugar and 1/2 light brown sugar. I chopped the apples (all Granny Smith) vs slicing them, and I used 2 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/2 tsp nutmeg, 1/2 tsp cardamom, 1/4 tsp ginger and 1/4 tsp cloves, just to add more depth of flavor. Wonderfull!
Simple easy recipe. I just reduced the sugar amount by half and added 1/2 cup maple syrup instead. Came out great!
My family loves this cake!!!!
Amazing! Made for Christmas but instead of cinnamon sugar topping, used A whipped Brandy Cream, a hit!!

Delicious! I didn't make any adjustments. I used Granny Smith apples, and they were large apples! I still used 5 of them. I had to set a timer for beating the eggs and sugar; I have just an electric hand mixer, so it took some patience! The best way to eat this: slightly warmed up in the microwave with warm Mrs. Richardson's caramel topping.

Excellent with a few adjustments. I used 1 cup of sugar, 2 teaspoons of cinnamon and 1/2 cup of oil with 4 ounces of applesauce. The cake came out delicious. The sugar and cinnamon sprinkled on top added a nice touch. 5 apples thinly sliced was just the right amount.

A very easy and flexible recipe. Depending how big your apples and eggs are you may need to adjust quantity. I used three large apples (instead of 5 smaller ones) and 4 eggs but next time will cut the eggs down to 3. Next time I will also chop the apple much finer so it will cook more evenly. I used less than a cup of brown sugar and it was plenty sweet enough, so I can't imagine using 2 cups of sugar. I also substituted butter for the vegetable oil. Delicious!
Keep coming back to this recipe it is such a nice cake and so easy to make. Good way to use up extra apples.
This cake is absolutely delicious! I used a combination or Macoun and Ida Red apples. I will definitely be making this again.
I tried to half this recipe and the sugar was 2 teaspoons I followed the recipe for 12 serves and it was dry and not sweet enough. A fail. Needed lots of icecream to eat it. Disappointed

Loved this apple cake. I need a non dairy one, so this is perfect. I also cut down to 1 1/2 cups sugar, used applesauce and 1/2 cup of oil. 2 tsps of cinnamon was perfect with the extra cinnamon on top. Very good. Will make again
This came out so delicious! I am making another one today. The apples came out great not muchie. Thanks this is now a favorite recipe

I only gave 4 stars because of the time it took - 15 minutes of mixing? Ugh. It's really delicious. I feel you shouldn't reduce the cinnamon as others have said. Took up a suggestion and sliced up another apple and laid on top for a nice touch. Also cut down on the sugar to 3/4 cup. I will make this again. It's great for using those apples after apple picking.

Excellent. This cake was really good. Nice and moist, and not too sweet. I used 4 granny smith and one gala because that is what I had. I would use all granny smith if I had them. Loved that there was a lot of apple in this cake. I loved this cake as is so I'm not sure I would change anything.
Add extra Apples, Serve Chilled!!!

this is sooooooo good. i tried a small piece when it came out of the oven and couldn't stop myself from eating three whole slices. it is dangerously good. moist, tender, so much flavour. a very memorable recipe, this is a keeper for sure. i baked it without walnuts because i just didn't have any and you don't need them at all. this cake carries itself.
Perfect as is!!!
following the recipe, but added slightly more sugar..3 small apples, and 2 red pears

I wasn't sure if electric mixer was handheld or stand mixer so I used my stand mixer and it turned out fine, 5 apples in the end seemed like a lot, I had to switch to a larger bowl to mix in the apples and nuts, I added some raisins I softened in boiling water. I used the spiralizer attachment to my mixer to peel, core and slice, I think next time I would choose the apples a bit.
Loved this. I made mine w/ pears and raisins instead of apples and nuts. Definitely a keeper!
Half the sugar. Excellent!!!
My family loved this cake. I will make it again. The only change I made was to use pecans instead of walnuts.

Very good recipe! I followed it exactly except when it came to the apples. I used 4 apples instead of 5 and found that it was still a lot. I recommend using 2-3. I also recommend dicing them instead slicing them. Other than that, it’s a very good recipe!
Very good. I leave about a third or half of the apples "chunky diced". This way you get a bites of whole apple when eating.
Yummy, reduced the amount of sugar
It was delicious, but way too sweet. Next time I make this cake, I will reduce the sugar to 1.5 cups.
Delicious, really that’s all you have to say!

I’ll give this 5 stars for moistness and ease of making! I only had 4 apples on hand, but that was plenty in this lovely cake. The only other change I made followed what other reviews indicated and reduced sugar to 1.5 cups instead of 2. That was also plenty sweet. All in all, this was very easy to make and it’s very tasty. For a toddler friendly version, we dropped the nuts. The apple pieces in the cake provide that added texture.
I substituted half a cup of applesauce for half a cup of the oil and only put 1 and 3/4 cup of sugar.
7 apples as opposed to 5. No nuts.
Very good,, I used a slightly smaller pan, turned out well
Wonderful cake! It tasted even better after a couple of days. I added one more apple but followed the recipe as written and served it with vanilla ice cream. I will be making it again.
Followed the recipe except left out the nuts because I didn't have any on hand. It was moist and delicious, and I'll definitely be making it again!
This turned out great. I baked it in a mini loaf pan for about 25 minutes. The loafs are very moist and freeze well for later.

I had to adjust the recipe for allergies. Instead of all purpose flour, I used 2 cups of Bob's Red Mill Gluten Free Biscuit & Baking Mix, (it has baking powder and salt in it) I added 2 tsp of baking powder and didn't add more salt. I followed the recipe accurately other than that. I baked it at given temp for 55 minutes. It was delicious and light. I will repeat this recipe again!
This is absolutely delicious!
Very light. Delicious!
I added boiled apple cider syrup and cardamom, delicious!
We love this recipe. So moist and delicious. Loved reading alterations others made. May try replacing oil for vanilla yogurt or using a bunt pan but why mess with perfection??
Made this for my coworkers one day, the taste was good but I think it's a little too sweet. Next time I'll put less sugar in the cake (and the topping).
Great cake. I made the following changes: 1 stick melted butter and 1/2 cup oil, 1 cup light brown sugar instead of 1 cup oil and 2 cups white sugar.

This is a great cake! I used Cortland apples (just because they were extras), but will use more tasty apples next time. It’s still really tasty and moist! I diced the apples in small pieces so they are in every bite. I made a few small changes. Used 1/2 cup of brown sugar and 1-1/2 cups white. I thought 4 tsp. of cinnamon sounded like so much, so I cut it to 3 tsp., but I really think it would be fine with 4, so I’ll do that next time. I cut the oil to 3/4 cup just to save a few calories and added 1/4 cup of light sour cream. I beat the eggs and sugar for 5 minutes, thinking 15 was a mistake. Lastly, I used a little over a 1/2 cup of pecans because I didn’t have walnuts. When it was baking, I couldn’t believe how much it raised in the pan! The sugar and cinnamon topping is a nice touch. The topping is hard when it comes out of the oven but softens later. I’ll be making this cake again and again!

My husband loved it so much this is second one made this week!!! Moist and flavorful and a keeper. Husband told me first round I had to keep this recipe. So family favorite for sure in this house. Thank you for the recipe!!
Nice and most

A good recipe thatI made caramel apple cupcakes using this recipe. To counter the sweetness of the caramel, I reduced the sugar by 1/4 cup and used Granny Smith apples for the tartness. I also aded a teaspoon each of nutmeg and ground cloves.
This was the best cake ever, no changes made, perfect as it is

My family went apple picking today and I wanted to use some of the many, many apples we brought home, so I actually doubled the recipe and made 2 pans (one for us, one for my husband to take to work. Risky, right?). I coarsely chopped the apples (I used Macouns) into approximately 1/2" chunks (some chunks were bigger than others, which I think was a good thing) rather than using slices, but other than that, I followed the recipe as written. (Wait, not completely true - I used grape seed oil because I was out of vegetable oil.) I personally hate when people rate and write reviews for recipes when they've made a bunch of changes to it, so I like to follow the actual recipe as closely as possible to see if it actually needs all the changes that the reviewers mention in their reviews that aren't actually for the recipe as written. The changes are not necessary, folks. My husband, 12 year old daughter, 3 year old son, and I all agree that the cake is delicious. This recipe is a keeper.
It was super yummy! I made it exactly as written
I doubled this recipe to make one for a new neighbor and one for our house. I did not change any of the ingredients. It turned out great! This is definitely something I will make again.

We are loaded with apples thanks to one tree. I spent the better part of a day prepping apples and bagging them with my Food Saver but the freezer is full. Time to use them. This recipe looked great BUT all that sugar..... We discussed it and decided to try subbing the sugar for Monk Fruit Sweetener - zero calories (from the sugar). We both tried it and declared it a success. It tastes great! Monk Fruit does not work for jams and jellies since it crystallizes with liquid but it seems fine in baked goods.
Excellent. Made it as written. Except I added about 3/4 cup cranberries sliced in half. Very quick and easy. This is a favorite!

Delicious and moist! I had a hard time telling if it was done or not inside because it was so moist. I used the full 2 cups of sugar, and I feel it could have used less. (My kids thought it was great, as is)

Super good! I reduced the sugar to 1-1/2 cups.
I layered additional apple slices on top to decorate and then put sugar/cinnamon on top. Awesome!
Turned out great!

Delicious! I have 3 apple trees, all producing like crazy and I've been hunting for apple recipes. The apples I have are small, so I didn't use 5 apples as stated in the recipe but instead peeled and chunked 6 cups of apples. I didn't mix the eggs and sugar for 15 minutes because it seemed like overkill--3 minutes sufficed. Used 1 1/2 cups sugar because my apples are pretty sweet. Added about 4 cups of apples to the batter and sprinkled the remaining 2 cups on top of the cake, then cinnamon/sugar combo. This cake is very moist, with the perfect amount of sweetness, apple-ness, and cinnamon-ness to it. I will make it many times, I'm sure!

I made it according to the recipe except a 1/2 cup less of sugar.
My family and friends enjoyed it very much.
excellent cake but I modified it like in the reviews with 2 cups of sugar, 3/4 cup oil and 2 tea spoons Cinnamon
Unlike most reviewers, I made this just as the recipe is written. This is delicious just as written. Probably the best apple cake I have ever had. Will make again as it is written.
My children love this cake and so do I it is moist with a little crust on the top. I also like how the apples are not mushy.. I have made this recipe many of times and it always turns out great!
I only use 3 apples witch was just 2 cups and I added 1 cup of water
Good cake. Made exactly as directed. Was done in 50 minutes. Nice with vanilla ice cream.
I found it a bit too sweet for my taste. My kids loved it, though.
Wondered about baking time if you cut recipe in half! I’ll find out. It’s in the oven now. I’ll write a review then!

So good my husband - who hates chunks in food- had seconds! So easy my toddlers made most of it! (Other than cutting the apples) we used half brown and half white sugar, going a bit scant on the measurements. We also went a bit shy on the oil as well and used grape seed oil. We left out the nuts. We used 2 large Fuji apples and 4 small Granny Smith sour apples, dicing them into small pieces.. Baked it ten minutes longer than recommended and it was perfect!!!

Yum! I scaled it for 6 servings and made it in two mini loaf pans. Baked at 365 for 30 minutes. I used two granny smith apples (instead of 1.25) and whole wheat flour. And I only whipped the egg for about 5 minutes. Served with whipped cream. It was very yummy in a homey kind of way! Going to freeze the other loaf and see how that works. ;-)

I tried this for the first time! Very easy to make, used my kitchen and apple peeler/slicer device to help with the apples, quartered apple slices and mixed into prepared batter. Everyone loved it. I didn't put walnuts into it this time as my wife doesn't like them. I will try to add them at another time to see if it changes the texture.
Followed the recipe exactly and it came out fabulous! Very moist, perfectly spiced and smelled amazing.

I made this for a group and everyone raved! I used three different kinds of apples, all from my freezer. I added a bit of allspice as recommended by others. I also threw in a few raisins. This is so moist and serves well cold from the refrigerator with a dollop of whip cream.

I made this delicious Apple Cake IV last night, and loved it. Simple to make, moist, plenty of Apple (I used 7 as they were medium to small) Added 1/4 cup light brown sugar and 1 3/4 white also 1 tsp brown sugar with the 4 tsp white and cinnamon on top. Just my preference. Great Cake can't wait to make over the holidays.

Came out very good, a little on the moist side but that's to be expected with the apples. Made the house smell wonderful.

I did not whip the eggs and sugar for the full 15 minutes. Maybe 10 minutes or so, came out fine.
I used 9x13 pan and cake went all over my oven. Definitely need larger pan. Tasty cake will definitely make again
Great moist cake. Kids loved it

This is fantastic, and I not a great cook/baker. I followed direction exactly, but 2nd time I added 1t nutmeg and 1/2 c diced fresh strawberries. Very moist and nice crunchy crust. My neighbors love me more now!
Delish! I used honeycrisp apples, and the cake was moist and delicious. Kids absolutely loved it, and they don't usually like cake.
So yummy. Just not sure why you have to mix for 15 minutes?
yummy tummy fummy

Pretty good. I like that it used so many apples. I needed to use a bit more flour than stated, but taste was decent. Since I was using "cardboard" red delicious apples from my Mom-in-law's tree, I added some apple cider vinegar to deepen the flavor profile a bit. That was a good choice.
I would make it again—easy to make and great to have on hand for the weekend.
Very moist and super delicious. Everyone loved it!

I only had four apples, so that's what I used, but it came out great. I took the advice of the other reviewers and cut the sugar to 1 3/4 c, and also reduced the oil to 3/4 c. It's VERY moist, and it was absolutely SPECTACULAR with French Vanilla Ice Cream. YUMMY!
